required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Evaluation of BCMA-UCART
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety Evaluation of BCMA-UCART（Allogeneic Engineered T-cells Expressing Anti-BCMA Chimeric Antigen Receptor）in the Treatment of Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma

collaborator.agency: Shanghai Tongji Hospital, Tongji University School of Medicine
Second Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

brief_summary.textblock: This trial aims to evaluate the safety and efficacy of BCMA-UCART in treating patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.

detailed_description.textblock: BCMA(B-Cell maturation antigen) is a tumor antigen of multiple myeloma. Using a genetic engineering strategy to assemble an anti-BCMA CAR(chimeric antigen receptor) in T cells will help these CART cells to recognize and kill BCMA-expressing MM tumor cells. BCMA-UCART is a kind of allogeneic CART, originating from T cells of health donors. This open-label, dose-escalation study aims to evaluate the safety and anti-tumor efficacy of BCMA-UCART in treating relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 90 days after T cell infusion
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients in whom a response among complete response or partial response, as defined by International Myeloma Working group(IMWG) response criteria , will be observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and Severity of Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 35 days after T cell infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v4.03 criteria
Detect the duration of BCMA-UCART after injection using FACS or Q-PCR

arm_group.description: Each subject will accept one of the following dosages of BCMA-UCART cells intravenously (IV) on day 0: 0.5-1*10~6/KgBW, 1-2*10~6/KgBW,2-3*10~6/KgBW.

intervention.description: A conditioning therapy with cyclophosphamide and fludarabine will be conducted for subjects before CART therapy.

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Tongji Hospital, Tongji University School of Medicine
